title: Language, migration and citizenship: cross-national perspectives
abstractText: One of the most pressing issues in contemporary European societies is the need to promote integration and social inclusion in the context of rapidly increasing migration. A particular challenge confronting national governments is the need to accommodate speakers of an ever increasing number of languages within what in most cases are still perceived as monolingual indigenous populations. This has given rise to public debates in many countries on proposals to impose a requirement on competence in a 'national' language and culture as a condition for acquiring citizenship. These workshops will bring together international experts on language policy to exchange knowledge and ideas on this question in order to develop a more well-informed basis for public discussion and policy formation
